III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Recently, an unknown staff put Youth A in a choke hold and told
youth that if they are bad, they will be locked up in jail. Youth A
had a red mark in the crack of their left eye.
Investigation This complaint was transferred to DCWL and assigned on
03/07/2024.
Interviews:
I contacted Complainant on 03/07/2024, no additional information
was provided.
I interviewed Foster Care Worker on 03/07/2024 via telephone.
Foster Care Worker reported Youth A is autistic and has extensive
behavioral issues and does not want to be at the agency. Youth A
has made similar allegations in the past that were found to be
untrue. She saw Youth A on 02/22/2024 and he did not express
any concerns. Foster Care Worker received a call on 03/06/2024
from Youth A’s grandmother indicating Youth A told her a male
staff choked and threaten him. Foster Care Worker expressed no
concerns regarding the agency or staff.
I interviewed Youth A at the agency on 03/07/2024. Youth A is 8
years old. Youth A was observed and there were no red marks or
bruises on his face. Youth A denied being choked by staff but said
Supervisor 2 punched him in the stomach last night while he was
in his bedroom. Youth A said he was in the bedroom alone when
Supervisor 2 punched him in the stomach. Youth A denied having
had any marks or bruises on his face. Youth A denied any staff
telling him he will go to jail if he is bad.
2

I interviewed Administrator at the agency on 03/07/2024.
Administrator reported there has been no incident reports
involving Youth A and Supervisor 2. He said Staff 1 was assigned
to Youth A yesterday evening. Administrator said Youth A has not
reported being choked or threatened by any staff.
I interviewed Staff 1 at the agency on 03/07/2024. Staff 1 is a
youth specialist and has been working at the agency for 4 months.
Staff 1 reported he was the specialist assigned to Youth A on
03/06/2024. Staff 1 denied witnessing Supervisor 2 speak or have
any physical contact with Youth A. Staff 1 said Supervisor 2 came
into Youth A’s bedroom last night around 9:15pm to assist with
turning on the white noise machine. Staff 1denied witnessing
Supervisor 2 or any other staff choke, punch, or threaten Youth A.
Staff 1 did not observe Youth A to have any marks or bruises on
his face.
I interviewed Supervisor 1 at the agency on 03/07/2024.
Supervisor 1 reported he was working on 03/06/2024 and did not
witness Supervisor 2 or any other staff choke, punch, or threaten
Youth A. Supervisor 1 denied observing any marks or bruises on
Youth A. There are no incident reports involving Supervisor 2 and
Youth A.
I interviewed Supervisor 2 via telephone on 03/20/2024.
Supervisor 2 has been working at the agency for nine years and
has no disciplinary reports. Supervisor 2 denied punching,
choking, or threatening Youth A. Supervisor 2 reported he went to
Youth A’s bedroom on 03/06/2024 around 9:15pm to help Staff 1
turn on the white noise machine. He denied speaking or having
any interaction with Youth A.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage from 03/06/2024 was reviewed on 03/07/2024.
(Note: there is no audio). Staff 1 is seen sitting outside Youth A’s
room at 9:15 pm, Staff 1 goes into the bedroom, a few seconds
later Supervisor 2 goes into the bedroom. At 09:16pm Supervisor
2 walks out of the bedroom with Staff 1 behind him. Staff 1 then
sits on the chair by Youth A’s bedroom.
Documents Reviewed:
• Personnel file for Supervisor 2- no disciplinary action.
Analysis The facility is compliant with the rule, based on interviews with
staff and youth. There is no evidence Staff 2 put Youth A in a
choke hold or had any direct contact with Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
3

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
